text: nice <@UD53A9UUR> I’ll see how it goes since it’s a primary display property… i have the workflow set up but not sure how that will work yet

dang it was a good idea <@UD53A9UUR> but unfortunately setting the “full_name” property as the primary display automatically makes the field required :cry:

Which just makes the hs users have to fill it out instead of automatically concatenating the first / last names. Is there something I’m missing?
no...you are probably right.  could overwrite the initial value i guess
I could potentially try the full name field and split it – but the middle name weirdos will ruin that lol
<@UGDF9EBPW>, i know you wrote a custom coded action to capitalize middle names.  any thoughts?
sorry to pull you from obama :wink:
Oof, that one is hard, I simply had a very very large array with all possible middle names in the Netherlands and used that to filter the firstname, middle name and last name
alright, john.  get out the phone book
Cause we have stuff like Dennis _de_ Edson, Dennis _van de_ Edson, Dennis _van_ Edson

So in the end I would split the fullname based on spaces, and grab the first word as the first name and the last word as the last name and we had to manually check each submission for errors if they contained more than 3 words.
